intro: Bystropogon kuntzeanum, commonly known as the Kuntze's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its leafy shoots and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant lacks true roots and absorbs water and nutrients through its haustoria, which attach to the host's vascular system. It is native to regions of southern Africa and is often found in forested areas. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have significant impacts on the health of its host trees.
